comment_text:
Hi! Dr. Chris Alipio, through the Acute Psychiatric Unit of Amang Rodriguez Memorial Medical Center in Marikina, offers FREE consultation on weekdays. Since the clinic is government-funded and -run, you would have to line up and secure a slot. Otherwise, you could also set an appointment for consultation in his private clinic in Tandang Sora, Quezon City for a fee. (I've been going to ARMMC since February and I only paid Php 100 for the OPD card. Lines are also bearable if you come early)
Other details here:
https://pinoymentalhealthblog.com/profile/
https://www.reddit.com/r/Philippines/comments/7e8loi/free_psychiatry_clinic_in_marikina_an_update/

If y'all don't want to talk to a person first, try visiting La Mesa Ecopark near Commonwealth Avenue, Quezon City. Only PHP20 entrance fee if you have a student ID (40-50php regular fee). The park is so huge it has horses, a lake, a koi pond, swimming pools, and an orchid garden!!! Lots of trees and quiet spaces too. ğŸ‘½ You can also visit the Facebook post (dated March 5, 2018) of the UP Diliman University Student Council where they posted their Mental Health directory for more resources (also available at tinyurl.com/USC-MHdirectory). ğŸ¢

Anonymous recommendation: â€œRe therapist in Manila: Viola Torres of UP Center for Women's and Gender Studies in Diliman, QC. She accepts walk-in clients but, to be sure, try to come by and agree on a schedule with her. She's there every Tuesday and Thursday, from 2-6pm. I worked with her from 2012-2015. She helped me recover from depression after I was severely abused by a former SO. She is also now the therapist of my current partner.â€

Submitted: "Hey there. Iâ€™m recommending Dr. Karina Perez from Philippine General Hospital. Itâ€™s a public hospital located in Manila City but definitely offers the best evaluation and assessment. Doctors are mostly from University of the Philippines."

submission: "Hi! In line with this, I'm recommending Dr. Marie Pearl Lei Reyes of Protacio Hospital. A paychiatrist who has a warm and welcoming charisma. She's very nice.

Other one is also my neuropsychiatrist, Dr. Alejandro F. Diaz of San Juan de Dios Hospital / St. Lukes / UST Hospital.

Yes I've been through 2 doctors because of changes in my sched as I started working and shifting work. But I've had a very nice exp with the 2 professionals."
